inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The study will use a randomized controlled trial design.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patients will be randomly assigned to either group A or B using sealed opaque envelopes containing computer-generated random numbers.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The study personnel will be blinded to the treatment assignment, and the placebo and LOLA will be similar in appearance and mode of administration.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Enrollment of patients, assessing eligibility, and obtaining informed consent will be carried out by one of the investigators.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patients will receive either placebo or LOLA at a dose of 30 grams daily, by intravenous infusion over 24 hours.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Biochemical and microbiologic tests will be done at baseline and during treatment to diagnose Spontaneous Bacterial Peritonitis and monitor liver function.

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient is a 55-year-old man with Parkinson's disease, but there is no mention of terminal illness.

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: There is no information about the patient's liver function or history of liver disease.

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: There is no mention of hepatocellular carcinoma in the patient's medical history.

notes: The patient has Parkinson's disease, but there is no information about liver function or other exclusion criteria. The study appears to be relevant based on the inclusion criteria.
